title: Lexus' futuristic electric concept car is basically Minority Report
text:
The Lexus LF-30 is straight out of our sci-fi dreams (Lexus)

The Tokyo Motor Show has started its engines over in Japan and luxury brand Lexus was quick off the mark with an intriguing new concept car.

The Lexus LF-30 is so futuristic in its approach to motoring that it may as well have just driven off the set of Minority Report, Blade Runner or any other sci-fi movie.

Obviously being a concept car, it’s not meant for full production but serves as a bit of a road map for Lexus’ future electrical efforts. The LF-30 coupe seats four – with the rear passengers being treated to what the company calls ‘artificial muscle technology’ that can ‘mold to their occupants’.

The glass windshield continues upwards to become a roof that can double up as a display for ‘a realistic star-filled sky, user-favorite videos, and even navigation.’

Lexus says the car can recognise voice commands and gestures for controlling things like navigation, climate control or entertainment within the car.

Other eyebrow-raising innovations include in-wheel electric motors on each wheel, rather than axel-based electric motors on a traditional car. Lexus says the car can adjust the output of each motor individually and in real time to allow for more dynamic driving.

‘Lexus Advanced Posture Control technology regulates drive power from the high-torque electric motors to adjust vehicle posture in line with human sensibilities,’ the company explained.

‘Fully independent control of the front and rear wheels allows for front, rear and all-wheel drive to be used according to the driving conditions. The compact and lightweight drive power units give greater freedom in vehicle packaging and help the driver enjoy time at the wheel regardless of the road surface or conditions.’

Too bad it’s just a concept (Lexus)

And – naturally – the car boasts a degree of autonomous driving that means the occupant could just sit back and stare out the roof if they want to.

‘The concept features advanced driving support functions – Chauffeur Mode and Guardian Mode – based on the Lexus Teammate latest autonomous driving technology,’ the Japanese carmaker explained.

‘Occupants can enjoy comfort and peace of mind during autonomous driving with advanced posture control technology being employed. Self-parking and a front door pick-up function, in which the LF-30 Electrified autonomously moves from driveway to doorstep, provide an especially high level of convenience.’

Can’t be futuristic without gull-wing doors (Lexus)

It features electric motors on each individual wheel (Lexus)

We say electric car, but it looks like a spaceship from this angle (Lexus)

Plenty of leg room (Lexus)

The seats can mold to the shape of your body (Lexus)

Sadly, it’s not able to fly (Lexus)
